intro: Cabralea pallescens, commonly known as the pale cabralea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Cabralea pallescens is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native environment.
